analyzed: śivāya tasya saṃruddham karma tiṣṭhati yat vinā
translated: The karma that is obstructed for his welfare remains without...

original: tad alpam api yajñāṅgaṃ dattvā yajñaphalaṃ labhet /
analyzed: tat alpam api yajña aṅgam dattvā yajña phalam labhet
translated: Having given even a little part of the sacrificial implements, one would obtain the fruit of the sacrifice.

analyzed: api kāśa kuśam sūtram gomayam samidh indhanam  /
translated: Even if it is just a blade of kusa grass, a thread, cow dung, or fuel as an offering,

analyzed: śiva yajña upayoga artham pravakṣyāmi samāsatas
translated: for the purpose of the Shiva sacrifice, I will explain in brief.

original: sarveṣāṃ śivabhaktānāṃ dadyād yat kiṃcid ādarāt /
analyzed: sarveṣām śiva bhaktānām dadyāt yat kiṃcid ādarāt
translated: Whatever one can, one should respectfully give to all devotees of Shiva.

analyzed: dattvā yajña phalam vidyāt kimu tad vastu dānataḥ
translated: Having given, one should know it to be the fruit of the sacrifice, what to speak of giving those things...

analyzed: iti śivopaniṣadi phala upakaraṇa pradāna adhyāyaḥ ṣaṣṭhaḥ
translated: Thus ends the sixth chapter on the offering of fruits and implements in the Shiva Upanishad.

analyzed: atha svarga apavarga arthe pravakṣyāmi samāsatas
translated: Now, for the sake of heaven and liberation, I will explain in brief,

analyzed: sarveṣām śiva bhaktānām śiva ācāram anuttamam
translated: the excellent conduct of Shiva for all devotees of Shiva...

original: śivaḥ śivāya bhūtānāṃ yasmād dānaṃ prayacchati /
analyzed: śivaḥ śivāya bhūtānām yasmāt dānam prayacchati
translated: Since Shiva gives gifts for the welfare of beings,

original: gurumūrtiḥ sthitas tasmāt pūjayet satataṃ gurum // / //
analyzed: guru mūrtiḥ sthitaḥ tasmāt pūjayet satatam gurum
translated: therefore one should always worship the guru, who is present in the form of the guru.

original: nālakṣaṇe yathā liṅge sāṃnidhyaṃ kalpayec chivaḥ /
analyzed: na alakṣaṇe yathā liṅge sāṃnidhyam kalpayet śivaḥ
translated: Just as Shiva does not manifest in a linga without characteristics,

original: alpāgame gurau tadvat sāṃnidhyaṃ na prakalpayet // / //🔽śivajñānārthatattvajñaḥ prasannamanasaṃ gurum /
analyzed: alpa āgame gurau tadvat sāṃnidhyam na prakalpayet  śiva jñāna artha tattva jñaḥ prasanna manasam gurum
translated: Similarly, one should not assume the presence of the Guru in a place where there is little to be known.🔽One who knows the truth of the essence of the knowledge of Śiva, with a serene mind,

original: śivaḥ śivaṃ samāsthāya jñānaṃ vakti na hītaraḥ // / //
analyzed: śivaḥ śivam samāsthāya jñānam vakti na hi itaraḥ
translated: Śiva, having resorted to Śiva, speaks the knowledge, not otherwise.

original: guruṃ ca śivavad bhaktyā namaskāreṇa pūjayet /
analyzed: gurum ca śiva vat bhaktyā namaskāreṇa pūjayet
translated: And one should worship the Guru with devotion like Śiva, with salutations,

original: kṛtāñjalis trisaṃdhyaṃ ca bhūmivinyastamastakaḥ // / //🔽na viviktam anācāntam /
analyzed: kṛtāñjaliḥ trisaṃdhyam ca bhūmi vinyasta mastakaḥ  na viviktam an ācāntam
translated: With folded hands, at the three junctions, and with one's head bowed to the ground.🔽Not in a secluded place, not after rinsing the mouth,

analyzed: caṅkramantam tathā ākulam
translated: Not while walking, not in a noisy place,

original: samādhisthaṃ vrajantaṃ ca namaskuryād guruṃ budhaḥ // / //
analyzed: samādhi stham vrajantam ca namaskuryāt gurum budhaḥ
translated: A wise person should not salute the Guru while he is in meditation or traveling.

analyzed: vyākhyāne tad samāptau ca saṃpraśne snāna bhojane
translated: In explanation, at the completion of that, in inquiry, in bathing and eating,

original: bhuktvā ca śayane svapne namaskuryāt sadā gurum // / //
analyzed: bhuktvā ca śayane svapne namaskuryāt sadā gurum
translated: And after eating, in bed, in sleep, one should always salute the Guru.

analyzed: grāma antaram abhiprepsuḥ guroḥ kuryāt pradakṣiṇam
translated: Desiring to go to another village, one should circumambulate the Guru,

analyzed: sārvāṅgika praṇāmam ca punar kuryāt tad āgataḥ
translated: And having come back, one should again perform a full-body prostration.

original: parvotsaveṣu sarveṣu dadyād gandhapavitrakam /🔽śivajñānasya cārambhe pravāsagamanāgatau // / //
analyzed: parva utsaveṣu sarveṣu dadyāt gandha pavitrakam  śiva jñānasya ca ārambhe pravāsa gamana āgatau
translated: In all the festivals of the Parvas, one should offer perfume and pavitraka,🔽At the beginning of the knowledge of Śiva, when going on a journey,

analyzed: śiva dharma vrata ārambhe tad samāptau ca kalpayet
translated: At the beginning of the vow of Śiva Dharma, and at its completion, one should perform.

original: prasādanāya kupito vijitya ca ripuṃ tathā // / //🔽puṇyāhe grahaśāntau ca dīkṣāyāṃ ca sadakṣiṇam /
analyzed: prasādanāya kupitaḥ vijitya ca ripum tathā  puṇya ahe graha śāntau ca dīkṣāyām ca sa dakṣiṇam
translated: and having conquered the enemy in the same way, for the sake of propitiation.🔽On an auspicious day, during the pacification of planets, and during initiation, with proper dakshina,

original: āvārya padasaṃprāptau pavitre copavigrahe // / //🔽upānacchattraśayanaṃ vastram āsanabhūṣaṇam /🔽pātradaṇḍākṣasūtraṃ vā gurusaktaṃ na dhārayet // / //
analyzed: āvārya pada saṃprāptau pavitre ca upavigrahe  upānah chattra śayanam vastram āsana bhūṣaṇam  pātra daṇḍa akṣa sūtram vā guru saktam na dhārayet
translated: when obstructing forces are removed, when attaining a position, and in a sacred battle,🔽one should not wear sandals, an umbrella, bedding, clothes, seat, ornaments,🔽a bowl, staff, or rosary that are attached to the guru.

analyzed: hāsya niṣṭhīvana āsphoṭam ucca bhāṣya vijṛmbhaṇam
translated: One should not laugh, spit, snap the fingers, speak loudly, yawn,

analyzed: pāda prasāraṇam gatim na kuryāt guru saṃnidhau
translated: stretch the feet, or walk in the presence of the guru.

analyzed: hīna anna pāna vastraḥ syāt nīca śayyā āsanaḥ guroḥ
translated: One should have inferior food, drink, and clothes, a low bed and seat for the guru,

original: na yatheṣṭaś ca saṃtiṣṭhet kalahaṃ ca vivarjayet // / //
analyzed: na yathā iṣṭaḥ ca saṃtiṣṭhet kalaham ca vivarjayet
translated: and should not remain as one pleases, and should avoid quarrels.

original: prativāte 'nuvāte vā na tiṣṭhed guruṇā saha /
analyzed: prativāte nuvāte vā na tiṣṭhet guruṇā saha
translated: One should not stand in the wind or against the wind in the presence of the guru,

original: asaṃśraye ca satataṃ na kiṃcit kīrtayed guroḥ // / //🔽anyāsakto na bhuñjāno na tiṣṭhann aparāṅmukhaḥ /
analyzed: asaṃśraye ca satatam na kiṃcid kīrtayet guroḥ  anya āsaktaḥ na bhuñjānaḥ na tiṣṭhan a parāṅmukhaḥ
translated: and should never speak ill of the guru.🔽One should not eat, stand, or turn one's back on the guru while engaged in other activities.

original: na śayano na cāsīnaḥ saṃbhāsyed guruṇā saha // / //
analyzed: na śayanaḥ na ca āsīnaḥ saṃbhāsyet guruṇā saha
translated: One should not converse with the guru while lying down or seated.

original: dṛṣṭvaiva gurum āyāntam uttiṣṭhed dūratas tvaram /
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā eva gurum āyāntam uttiṣṭhet dūratas tvaram
translated: Seeing the guru coming from afar, one should quickly stand up,

analyzed: anujñātaḥ ca guruṇā saṃviśet ca anu pṛṣṭhatas
translated: And having obtained the Guru's permission, he should lie down, not turning his back on him.

original: na kaṇṭhaṃ prāvṛtaṃ kuryān na ca tatrāvasaktikām /
analyzed: na kaṇṭham prāvṛtam kuryāt na ca tatra avasaktikām
translated: He should not cover his neck, nor should he wear a necklace there.

original: na pādadhāvanasnānaṃ yatra paśyed guruḥ sthitaḥ // / //
analyzed: na pāda dhāvana snānam yatra paśyet guruḥ sthitaḥ
translated: He should not wash his feet or bathe where the Guru is seen standing.

analyzed: na danta dhāvana abhyaṅgam āyāma udvartana kriyāḥ
translated: He should not clean his teeth, anoint himself, or perform the act of rubbing his body.

analyzed: utsarga paridhānam ca guroḥ kurvīta paśyataḥ
translated: He should perform the act of defecation and urination while the Guru is looking on.

original: gurur yad arpayet kiṃcid gṛhāsannaṃ tadañjalau /
analyzed: guruḥ yat arpayet kiṃcid gṛha āsannam tad añjalau
translated: Whatever the Guru may offer, whether near the house or in the hand,

original: pātre vā purataḥ śiṣyas tad vaktram abhivīkṣayan // / //
analyzed: pātre vā puratas śiṣyaḥ tat vaktram abhivīkṣayan  /
translated: The disciple, looking at his face, should receive it in a vessel or in his cupped hands.

original: yad arpayed guruḥ kiṃci tan namraḥ purataḥ sthitaḥ /
analyzed: yat arpayet guruḥ kiṃci tat namraḥ puratas sthitaḥ
translated: Whatever the Guru may offer, he, standing humbly before him,

original: pāṇidvayena gṛhṇīyat sthāpayet tac ca susthitam // / //🔽na guroḥ kīrtayen nāma paro'kṣam api kevalam /
analyzed: pāṇi dvayena gṛhṇīyat sthāpayet tat ca susthitam  na guroḥ kīrtayet nāma parokṣam api kevalam
translated: Should receive it with both hands and place it well.🔽He should not pronounce the Guru's name alone, even in secret,

analyzed: samāna saṃjñam anyam vā na āhvayīta tad ākhyayā
translated: Nor should he call another by the Guru's name, even if he has the same name.

original: svagurus tadguruś caiva yadi syātāṃ samaṃ kvacit /
analyzed: sva guruḥ tad guruḥ ca eva yadi syātām samam kvacid
translated: If the Guru and his Guru should happen to be together somewhere,

original: guror gurus tayoḥ pūjyaḥ svaguruś ca tadājñayā // / //
analyzed: guroḥ guruḥ tayoḥ pūjyaḥ sva guruḥ ca tad ājñayā
translated: The Guru's Guru is to be worshipped, and his own Guru by his order.

original: anivedya na bhuñjīta bhuktvā cāsya nivedayet /
analyzed: a nivedya na bhuñjīta bhuktvā ca asya nivedayet
translated: Without informing him, he should not eat, and after eating, he should inform him.

original: nāvijñāpya guruṃ gacched bahiḥ kāryeṇa kenacit // / //
analyzed: na a vijñāpya gurum gacchet bahis kāryeṇa kenacid
translated: One should not go outside for any purpose without informing the Guru.

analyzed: guru ājñayā karma kṛtvā tad samāptau nivedayet
translated: Having performed an act by the Guru's command, one should report its completion.

original: kṛtvā ca naityakaṃ sarvam adhīyītājñayā guroḥ // / //
analyzed: kṛtvā ca naityakam sarvam adhīyīta ājñayā guroḥ
translated: And having performed all the daily duties, one should study by the Guru's command.

analyzed: mṛd bhasma gomaya jalam pattra puṣpa indhanam samidh
translated: Clay, ash, cow dung, water, leaves, flowers, fuel, and kindling -

analyzed: paryāptam aṣṭakam hi etat guru artham tu samāharet
translated: this group of eight is sufficient, but one should collect more for the Guru's sake.

analyzed: bhaiṣajya āhāra pātrāṇi vastra śayyā āsanam guroḥ
translated: Medicines, food, vessels, clothes, bedding, and seats for the Guru -

analyzed: ānayet sarva yatnena prārthayitvā dhaneśvarān
translated: one should bring all these with great effort, even by begging from the lords of wealth.

analyzed: guroḥ na khaṇḍayet ājñām api prāṇān parityajet
translated: One should not disobey the Guru's command, even at the cost of one's life.

analyzed: paryaṭet pṛthivīm kṛtsnām sa śaila vana kānanām
translated: One may wander the entire earth with its mountains, forests, and groves,

analyzed: guru bhaiṣajya siddhi artham api gacchet rasātalam
translated: even going to the netherworld to obtain medicine for the Guru.

analyzed: yat ādiśet guruḥ kiṃcid tat kuryāt avicārataḥ
translated: Whatever the Guru may command, one should do without hesitation.

analyzed: na utthāpayet sukha āsīnam śayānam na prabodhayet
translated: One should not make one seated in comfort rise, nor awaken one lying down.

analyzed: āsīnaḥ gurum āsīnam abhigacchet pratiṣṭhitam
translated: Sitting, one should approach the seated guru who is standing.

analyzed: pathi prayāntam yāntam ca yatnāt viśramayet gurum
translated: On the path, one should carefully rest the guru who is going or has gone.

analyzed: kṣit pipāsā āturam snātam jñātvā śaktam ca bhojayet  /
translated: Having known the guru to be tired, hungry, thirsty, or having bathed, one should feed him if able.

analyzed: abhyaṅga udvartanam snānam bhojana ṣṭhīva mārjanam  gātra saṃvāhanam rātrau pāda abhyaṅgam ca yatnatas
translated: Massage, anointing, bathing, eating, wiping the feet,🔽massaging the body at night, and massaging the feet with effort.

analyzed: prātar prasādhanam dattvā kāryam saṃmārjana añjanam
translated: Having given morning grooming, the cleaning and application of collyrium should be done.

analyzed: sthāpya āsanam guroḥ pūjyam śiva jñānasya pustakam
translated: The seat of the guru should be installed and worshipped, along with the book of Śiva knowledge.

analyzed: tatra tiṣṭhet pratīkṣan tat guroḥ āgamanam kramāt

translated: And one should not utter his words, for by uttering them one goes to hell.

analyzed: guruḥ eva pitā mātā guruḥ eva paraḥ śivaḥ
translated: The Guru is indeed the father, the mother, the Guru is indeed the supreme Shiva.

analyzed: yasya eva niścitaḥ bhāvaḥ tasya muktiḥ na dūratas

translated: Whatever the Guru, the Lord, would do in regard to diet, conduct, and duties,

analyzed: tathā eva ca anukurvīta na anuyuñjīta kāraṇam
translated: One should do the same, and not inquire into the reason.

original: yajñas tapāṃsi niyamāt tāni vai vividhāni ca /
analyzed: yajñaḥ tapāṃsi niyamāt tāni vai vividhāni ca
translated: Sacrifices, austerities, and various observances,

analyzed: guru vākye tu sarvāṇi saṃpadyante na saṃśayaḥ
translated: All of these are accomplished without doubt by the word of the Guru.🔽Who else but Shiva, the Lord of all, the Supreme Brahman, the Supreme Soul,

analyzed: ajñāna paṅka nirmagnam yaḥ samuddharate janam
translated: Who lifts up the people sunk in the mud of ignorance,

analyzed: śiva jñāna ātma hastena kaḥ tam na pratipūjayet
translated: With the hand of the knowledge of Shiva, should not be worshipped by him?

analyzed: iti yaḥ pūjayet nityam guru mūrti stham īśvaram

analyzed: sarva pāpa vinirmuktaḥ prāpnoti paramam padam
translated: Being freed from all sins, attains the highest state.

analyzed: snātvā ambhasā bhasmanā vā śukla vastra upavītavān
translated: Having bathed with water or ashes, wearing a white garment and sacred thread,

analyzed: dūrvā garbha sthitam puṣpam guruḥ śirasi dhārayet
translated: The Guru should hold a flower placed in the womb of durva grass on his head.

analyzed: rocanālabhanam kuryāt dhūyayet ātmanaḥ tanum
translated: He should apply rocanā, and fumigate his body,

analyzed: aṅgulīya akṣa sūtram ca karṇa mātre ca dhārayet
translated: And should wear a ring and rosary reaching up to his ear.

translated: Such a glorious guru should always remain concentrated.

translated: Since Sadasiva, the guru, always remains for the purpose of imparting knowledge,

analyzed: dhārayet pāduke nityam mṛdu varma prakalpite
translated: he should always wear sandals made of soft leather.

translated: Taking a staff or an umbrella, he should wander outside the hermitage.

translated: Having made the foot-places with leaves etc., he should enter the temple.

analyzed: pātra āstarita pādaḥ ca
translated: With the feet covered with a plate.

analyzed: nityam bhuñjīta vāgyataḥ
translated: He should always eat silently.

original: na pādau dhāvayet kāṃsye lohe vā parikalpite /
analyzed: na pādau dhāvayet kāṃsye lohe vā parikalpite
translated: He should not wash his feet in a brass or iron vessel.

analyzed: śaucayet tṛṇa garbhāyām dvitīyāyām tathā ācamet  na raktam ulbaṇam vastram dhārayet kusumāni ca
translated: He should clean himself in a vessel lined with grass, and then rinse his mouth.🔽He should not wear red or fancy clothes or flowers.

analyzed: na bahis gandha mālyāni vāsāṃsi malināni ca
translated: He should not wear external perfumes, garlands, or dirty clothes.

analyzed: keśa asthīni kapālāni kārpāsa asthi tuṣāṇi ca
translated: Hair, bones, skulls, cotton seeds, and straw,

analyzed: amedhya aṅgāra bhasmāni na adhitiṣṭhet rajāṃsi ca

translated: One should not crush such things with one's hands.

original: na dantakhādanaṃ kuryād romāṇy utpāṭayen na ca // / //🔽na padbhyām ullikhed bhūmiṃ loṣṭakāṣṭhaiḥ kareṇa vā /
analyzed: na danta khādanam kuryāt romāṇi utpāṭayet na ca  na padbhyām ullikhet bhūmim loṣṭa kāṣṭhaiḥ kareṇa vā
translated: One should not gnaw with one's teeth, nor pull out one's hair.🔽One should not scratch the ground with one's feet, clods of earth, or a stick, nor with one's hand.

original: na nakhāṃś ca nakhair vidhyān na kaṇḍūyen nakhais tanum // / //
analyzed: na nakhān ca nakhaiḥ vidhyāt na kaṇḍūyet nakhaiḥ tanum  /
translated: One should not pierce one's nails with one's nails, nor scratch one's body with one's nails.

original: muhurmuhuḥ śiraḥ śmaśru na spṛśet karajair budhaḥ /
analyzed: muhur muhur śiraḥ śmaśru na spṛśet karajaiḥ budhaḥ
translated: A wise person should not repeatedly touch his head and beard with his nails.

original: na likṣākarṣaṇaṃ kuryād ātmano vā parasya vā // / //🔽sauvarṇyaraupyatāmraiś ca śṛṅgadantaśalākayā /
analyzed: na likṣā ākarṣaṇam kuryāt ātmanaḥ vā parasya vā  sauvarṇya raupya tāmraiḥ ca śṛṅga danta śalākayā
translated: One should not remove lice from oneself or others.🔽One should scratch one's body with golden, silver, or copper needles, or with a horn, bone, or bamboo stick.

analyzed: deha kaṇḍūyanam kāryam vaṃśa kāṣṭhīka vīraṇaiḥ
translated: One should not scratch one's body with bamboo, wood, or reed.

original: na vicittaṃ prakurvīta diśaś caivāvalokayan /🔽na śokārtaś ca saṃtiṣṭhed dhūtvā pāṇau kapolakam // / //
analyzed: na vicittam prakurvīta diśaḥ ca eva avalokayan  na śoka ārtaḥ ca saṃtiṣṭhet dhūtvā pāṇau kapolakam
translated: One should not look in all directions while scratching.🔽One should not stand in sorrow, covering one's face with one's hands.

analyzed: na pāṇi pāda vāc cakṣuḥ śrotra śiśna guda udaraiḥ
translated: One should not scratch one's body with one's hands, feet, speech, eyes, ears, penis, anus, or belly.

original: cāpalāni na kurvīta sa sarvārtham avāpnuyāt // / //
analyzed: cāpalāni na kurvīta sa sarva artham avāpnuyāt
translated: One should not be fickle, for one attains all goals.

original: na kuryāt kenacid vairam adhruve jīvite sati /
analyzed: na kuryāt kenacid vairam adhruve jīvite sati
translated: One should not make enmity with anyone, when life is uncertain.

analyzed: loka kautūhalam pāpam saṃdhyām ca parivarjayet
translated: One should avoid worldly curiosity, sin, and the twilight.

original: na kudvāreṇa veśmāni nagaraṃ grāmam āviśet /
analyzed: na ku dvāreṇa veśmāni nagaram grāmam āviśet
translated: One should not enter a house, city, or village through a side door.

original: na divā prāvṛtaśirā rātrau prāvṛtya paryaṭet // / //
analyzed: na divā prāvṛta śirāḥ rātrau prāvṛtya paryaṭet
translated: One should not walk around with one's head covered during the day or at night.

original: nātibhramaṇaśīlaḥ syān na viśec ca gṛhād gṛham /
analyzed: na ati bhramaṇa śīlaḥ syāt na viśet ca gṛhāt gṛham
translated: One should not be excessively fickle, nor should one go from house to house.

analyzed: na ca ajñānam adhīyīta śiva jñānam samabhyaset
translated: One should not study what is unknown, but practice the knowledge of Śiva.

original: śivajñānaṃ paraṃ brahma tad ārabhya na saṃtyajet /
analyzed: śiva jñānam param brahma tat ārabhya na saṃtyajet
translated: The knowledge of Śiva is the supreme Brahman; having begun it, one should not abandon it.

original: brahmāsādhya ca yo gacched brahmahā sa prakīrtitaḥ // / //
analyzed: brahma āsādhya ca yaḥ gacchet brahma hā sa prakīrtitaḥ
translated: One who goes to the place of Śiva is declared to be a killer of Brahman.

analyzed: kṛtāñjaliḥ sthitaḥ śiṣyaḥ laghu vastram udak mukhaḥ
translated: The disciple, standing with folded palms, wearing light clothing, facing north,

analyzed: śiva mantram samuccārya prāc mukhaḥ dhyāpayet guruḥ
translated: the teacher, facing east, should teach, uttering the mantra of Śiva.

analyzed: nāgadanta ādi saṃbhūtam caturaśram su śobhanam
translated: Made of ivory etc., quadrangular, very beautiful,

analyzed: hema ratna citam vā api guroḥ āsanam uttamam
translated: adorned with gold and jewels, that is the excellent seat for the teacher.

original: na śuśrūṣārthakāmāś ca na ca dharmaḥ pradṛśyate /
analyzed: na śuśrūṣā artha kāmāḥ ca na ca dharmaḥ pradṛśyate
translated: If the disciples are not eager to serve and Dharma is not seen,

original: na bhaktir na yaśaḥ krauryaṃ na tam adhyāpayed guruḥ // / //🔽devāgnigurugoṣṭhīṣu vyākhyādhyayanasaṃsadi /
analyzed: na bhaktiḥ na yaśaḥ krauryam na tam adhyāpayet guruḥ  / deva agni guru goṣṭhīṣu vyākhyā adhyayana saṃsadi
translated: A teacher should not instruct him who has no devotion, who is not famous, who is cruel.🔽In the presence of gods, fire, preceptors, cows, assemblies, while explaining or studying,

analyzed: praśne vāde nṛte śauce dakṣiṇam bāhum uddharet  /
translated: in a question, debate, untruth, or impurity, one should raise the right arm.

analyzed: vaśe satata namraḥ syāt saṃhṛtya aṅgāni kūrma vat
translated: One should be under control, always humble, withdrawing the limbs like a tortoise,

analyzed: tad saṃmukham ca nirgacchet namaskāra purassaraḥ
translated: and depart facing them, preceded by salutations.

analyzed: deva agni guru viprāṇām na vrajet antareṇa tu
translated: One should not walk between gods, fire, preceptors, or Brahmins.

original: nārpayen na ca gṛhṇīyāt kiṃcid vastu tadantarā // / //🔽na mukhena dhamed agniṃ nādhaḥkuryān na laṅghayet /
analyzed: na arpayet na ca gṛhṇīyāt kiṃcid vastu tad antarā  na mukhena dhamet agnim na adhas kuryāt na laṅghayet
translated: One should not offer or receive anything in between them.🔽One should not blow on fire with one's mouth, nor make it go downwards or step over it.

original: na kṣiped aśuciṃ vahnau na ca pādau pratāpayet // / //
analyzed: na kṣipet aśucim vahnau na ca pādau pratāpayet  /
translated: One should not throw impurities into the fire, nor warm one's feet.

analyzed: tṛṇa kāṣṭha ādi gahane jantubhiḥ ca samākule
translated: In a place full of grass, wood, etc., and crowded with creatures,

original: sthāne na dīpayed agniṃ dīptaṃ cāpi tataḥ kṣipet // / //
analyzed: sthāne na dīpayet agnim dīptam ca api tatas kṣipet  /
translated: one should not light a fire, and if it is burning, one should extinguish it.

analyzed: agnim yugapad ānīya dhārayeta prayatnataḥ
translated: Having brought the fire together, one should hold it carefully.

original: jvalantaṃ na pradīpaṃ ca svayaṃ nirvāpayed budhaḥ // / //
analyzed: jvalantam na pradīpam ca svayam nirvāpayet budhaḥ
translated: A wise person should not himself extinguish a burning lamp.

analyzed: śiva vrata dharam dṛṣṭvā samutthāya sadā drutam
translated: Seeing one who observes the Shiva vow, one should always rise quickly,

original: śivo 'yam iti saṃkalpya harṣitaḥ praṇamet tataḥ // / //🔽bhogān dadāti vipulān liṅge saṃpūjitaḥ śivaḥ /
analyzed: śivaḥ yam iti saṃkalpya harṣitaḥ praṇamet tatas  bhogān dadāti vipulān liṅge saṃpūjitaḥ śivaḥ
translated: Considering him to be Śiva, one should then bow down with joy.🔽Śiva, when worshipped in the Liṅga, grants extensive enjoyments.

original: agnau ca vividhāṃ siddhiṃ gurau muktiṃ prayacchati // / //
analyzed: agnau ca vividhām siddhim gurau muktim prayacchati
translated: In the fire, he bestows various accomplishments, and in the Guru, he grants liberation.

analyzed: mokṣa artham pūjayet tasmāt guru mūrti stham īśvaram
translated: Therefore, one should worship the Lord residing in the form of the Guru for the sake of liberation.

original: gurubhaktyā labhej jñānaṃ jñānān muktim avāpnuyāt // / //🔽sarvaparvasu yatnena hy eṣu saṃpūjayec chivam /
analyzed: guru bhaktyā labhet jñānam jñānāt muktim avāpnuyāt  sarva parvasu yatnena hi eṣu saṃpūjayet śivam
translated: By devotion to the Guru, one will obtain knowledge, and through knowledge, one will attain liberation.🔽On all the Parvas (festival days), one should carefully worship Śiva in these (places).

original: kuryād āyatane śobhāṃ gurusthāneṣu sarvataḥ // / //🔽naradvayocchrite pīṭhe sarvaśobhāsamanvite /
analyzed: kuryāt āyatane śobhām guru sthāneṣu sarvatas  nara dvaya ucchrite pīṭhe sarva śobhā samanvite
translated: One should make the shrine beautiful in all the Guru places.🔽Having installed the Liṅga made of jewels on a pedestal raised by two men, endowed with all beauty,

original: saṃsthāpya maṇijaṃ liṅgaṃ sthāne kuryāj jagaddhitam // / //🔽annapānaviśeṣaiś ca naivedyam upakalpayet /
analyzed: saṃsthāpya maṇi jam liṅgam sthāne kuryāt jagat hitam  anna pāna viśeṣaiḥ ca naivedyam upakalpayet
translated: one should perform the welfare of the world in that place.🔽One should prepare Naivedya (food offerings) with special food and drink.

original: bhojayed vratinaś cātra svaguruṃ ca viśeṣataḥ // / //🔽pūjayec ca śivajñānaṃ vācayīta ca parvasu /
analyzed: bhojayet vratinaḥ ca atra sva gurum ca viśeṣataḥ  pūjayet ca śiva jñānam vācayīta ca parvasu
translated: Here, one should feed the vow-observers, and especially one's own Guru.🔽One should worship the Śiva knowledge and recite it on the Parvas (festival days).

analyzed: darśayet śiva bhaktebhyaḥ sat pūjām parikalpitām
translated: One should show the well-conceived worship to the devotees of Śiva.

original: priyaṃ brūyāt sadā tebhyaḥ pradeyaṃ cāpi śaktitaḥ /
analyzed: priyam brūyāt sadā tebhyaḥ pradeyam ca api śaktitaḥ
translated: One should always speak pleasantly to them and give according to one's ability.

original: evaṃ kṛte viśeṣeṇa prasīdati maheśvaraḥ // / //🔽chinnaṃ bhinnaṃ mṛtaṃ naṣṭaṃ vardhate nāsti kevalam /
analyzed: evam kṛte viśeṣeṇa prasīdati maheśvaraḥ  chinnam bhinnam mṛtam naṣṭam vardhate na asti kevalam
translated: When this is done, Mahesvara becomes especially pleased.🔽Cut, broken, dead, lost, non-existent - these words should not be spoken. One should speak auspicious words directly.

original: ity ādyān na vadec chabdān sākṣād brūyāt tu maṅgalam // / //🔽adhenuṃ dhenum ity eva brūyād bhadram abhadrakam /
analyzed: iti ādyān na vadet śabdān sākṣāt brūyāt tu maṅgalam  a dhenum dhenum iti eva brūyāt bhadram a bhadrakam
translated: One should say 'cow' instead of 'non-cow', 'good' instead of 'bad'.

original: kapālaṃ ca bhagālaṃ syāt paramaṃ maṅgalaṃ vadet // / //
analyzed: kapālam ca bhagālam syāt paramam maṅgalam vadet  /
translated: The skull should be called 'bhagola', and one should speak of the highest auspiciousness.

analyzed: aindram dhanuḥ maṇi dhanuḥ dāha kāṣṭha ādi candanam
translated: The rainbow is the 'jewel-bow', and burning wood etc. is 'sandalwood'.

original: svaryātaṃ ca mṛtaṃ brūyāc chivībhūtaṃ ca yoginam // / //
analyzed: svaryātam ca mṛtam brūyāt śivībhūtam ca yoginam  /
translated: One should say 'departed to heaven' instead of 'dead', and a yogi who has become one with Shiva.

original: dvidhābhūtaṃ vadec chinnaṃ bhinnaṃ ca bahudhā sthitam /🔽naṣṭam anveṣaṇīyaṃ ca riktaṃ pūrṇābhivardhitam // / //
analyzed: dvidhā bhūtam vadet chinnam bhinnam ca bahudhā sthitam  naṣṭam anveṣaṇīyam ca riktam pūrṇa abhivardhitam
translated: One should say 'cut' for something in two parts, and 'broken' for many parts.🔽One should say 'lost' for something to be searched for, and 'empty' for something increased by fullness.

analyzed: na asti iti śobhanam sarvam ādyam aṅga abhivardhanam
translated: 'Non-existent' is auspicious in all cases, and 'first' increases the limbs.

original: siddhimad brūhi gacchantaṃ suptaṃ brūyāt pravardhitam // / //
analyzed: siddhimat brūhi gacchantam suptam brūyāt pravardhitam
translated: One should say 'successful' for one going, and 'increased' for one sleeping.

analyzed: na mleccha mūrkha patitaiḥ krūraiḥ saṃtāpa vedibhiḥ
translated: Not with barbarians, fools, fallen ones, cruel ones, or those who know suffering,

original: durjanair avaliptaiś ca kṣudraiḥ saha na saṃvadet // / //🔽nādhārmikanṛpākrānte na daṃśamaśakāvṛte /
analyzed: durjanaiḥ avaliptaiḥ ca kṣudraiḥ saha na saṃvadet  / na adhārmika nṛpa ākrānte na daṃśa maśaka āvṛte
translated: One should not converse with wicked, arrogant, and petty people.🔽One should not dwell in a country afflicted by unrighteous kings, mosquitoes, and flies,

analyzed: na ati śīta jala ākīrṇe deśe roga prade vaset  /
translated: or in a place full of excessively cold water and disease.

analyzed: na āsanam śayanam pānam namaskāra abhivādanam
translated: One should not perform sitting, lying, drinking, salutations, or greetings

analyzed: sa upānatkaḥ prakurvīta śiva pustaka vācanam
translated: while wearing shoes. One should recite the Shiva Purana while standing.

original: ācāryaṃ daivataṃ tīrtham uddhūtodaṃ mṛdaṃ dadhi /
analyzed: ācāryam daivatam tīrtham uddhūta udam mṛdam dadhi
translated: The teacher, deity, sacred place, water sprinkled by the wind, clay, curd,

analyzed: vaṭam aśvattha kapilām dīkṣita udadhi saṃgamam
translated: the banyan tree, the holy fig tree, a tawny cow, the confluence of the consecrated water and the ocean,

analyzed: yāni ca eṣām prakārāṇi maṅgalāni iha kānicid
translated: and whatever other auspicious things there are here,

original: śivāyeti namaskṛtvā proktam etat pradakṣiṇam // / //🔽upānacchattravastrāṇi pavitraṃ karakaṃ srajam /
analyzed: śivāya iti namaskṛtvā proktam etat pradakṣiṇam  upānah chattra vastrāṇi pavitram karakam srajam
translated: having bowed to Shiva, this circumambulation is described.🔽One should not wear shoes, umbrellas, clothes, sacred threads, water pots, garlands,

original: āsanaṃ śayanaṃ pānaṃ dhṛtam anyair na dhārayet // / //
analyzed: āsanam śayanam pānam dhṛtam anyaiḥ na dhārayet  /
translated: seats, beds, drinks, or things held by others.

analyzed: pālāśam āsanam śayyām pāduke dantadhāvanam
translated: One should avoid a seat, bed, sandals, tooth cleaner,

original: varjayec cāpi niryāsaṃ raktaṃ na tu samudbhavam // / //
analyzed: varjayet ca api niryāsam raktam na tu samudbhavam
translated: and exudations, but not those that originate from blood.

analyzed: saṃdhyām upāsya kurvīta nityam deha prasādhanam
translated: Having performed the evening worship, one should always adorn one's body.

original: spṛśed vandec ca kapilāṃ pradadyāc ca gavāṃ hitam // / //
analyzed: spṛśet vandet ca kapilām pradadyāt ca gavām hitam
translated: One should touch, worship, and give for the welfare of cows.

original: yaḥ pradadyād gavāṃ samyak phalāni ca viśeṣataḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ pradadyāt gavām samyak phalāni ca viśeṣataḥ
translated: One who properly gives fruits, especially of cows,

original: kṣetram uddāmayec cāpi tasya puṇyaphalaṃ śṛṇu // / //
analyzed: kṣetram uddāmayet ca api tasya puṇya phalam śṛṇu  /
translated: and releases a field, listen to the meritorious fruit of that.

analyzed: yāvat kanda mūla phalāni ca
translated: For as long as its leaves, flowers, bulb, root, and fruits,

original: tāvadvarṣasahasrāṇi śivaloke mahīyate // / //🔽kṛśarogārtavṛddhānāṃ tyaktānāṃ nirjane vane /
analyzed: tāvat varṣa sahasrāṇi śiva loke mahīyate  kṛśa roga ārta vṛddhānām tyaktānām nirjane vane
translated: for that many thousands of years, he is honored in the world of Shiva.🔽For the emaciated, sick, and old cows, abandoned in the desolate forest,

analyzed: kṣudh pipāsā āturāṇām ca gavām vihvala cetasām
translated: suffering from hunger and thirst, with agitated minds,

original: nītvā yas tṛṇatoyāni vane yatnāt prayacchati /
analyzed: nītvā yaḥ tṛṇa toyāni vane yatnāt prayacchati
translated: he who carefully leads them and gives grass and water in the forest,

original: karoti ca paritrāṇaṃ tasya puṇyaphalaṃ śṛṇu // / //
analyzed: karoti ca paritrāṇam tasya puṇya phalam śṛṇu
translated: and provides protection, listen to the meritorious fruit of that.

analyzed: kula ekaviṃśaka upetaḥ patnī putra ādi saṃyutaḥ
translated: Endowed with twenty-one generations of family, along with wife, children, and others,

analyzed: mitra bhṛtyaiḥ upetaḥ ca śrīmat śiva puram vrajet
translated: accompanied by friends and servants, he goes to the glorious city of Shiva.

analyzed: tatra bhuktvā mahā bhogān vimānaiḥ sārvakāmikaiḥ
translated: Having enjoyed great pleasures there, with celestial vehicles fulfilling all desires,

original: sa mahāpralayaṃ yāvat tadante muktim āpnuyāt // / //
analyzed: sa mahāpralayam yāvat tad ante muktim āpnuyāt
translated: he would attain liberation at the end of that, until the great dissolution.

analyzed: go brāhmaṇa paritrāṇam sakṛt kṛtvā prayatnataḥ
translated: Having once carefully rescued cows and Brahmins,

original: mucyate pañcabhir ghorair mahadbhiḥ pātakair drutam // / //🔽ahiṃsā satyam asteyaṃ brahmacaryam akalkatā /
analyzed: mucyate pañcabhiḥ ghoraiḥ mahadbhiḥ pātakaiḥ drutam  ahiṃsā satyam asteyam brahmacaryam a kalka tā
translated: He is quickly freed from the five terrible and great sins.🔽Non-violence, truth, non-stealing, celibacy, and freedom from anger,

analyzed: akrodhaḥ guru śuśrūṣā śaucam saṃtoṣam ārjavam
translated: absence of anger, service to the guru, purity, contentment, and straightforwardness,

analyzed: ahiṃsā ādyāḥ yamāḥ pañca yatīnām parikīrtitāḥ
translated: the five restraints beginning with non-violence are proclaimed for ascetics.

analyzed: akrodha ādyāḥ ca niyamāḥ siddhi vṛddhi karāḥ smṛtāḥ
translated: And the observances beginning with absence of anger are remembered as bringing about the increase of spiritual power.

analyzed: daśa lākṣaṇikaḥ dharmaḥ śiva ācāraḥ prakīrtitaḥ
translated: The Dharma with ten characteristics is proclaimed to be the conduct of Shiva.

analyzed: yogi indrāṇām viśeṣeṇa śivayoga prasiddhaye
translated: In particular for the great yogis, for the accomplishment of Shiva's yoga.

original: na vindati naro yogaṃ putradārādisaṃgataḥ /🔽nibaddhaḥ snehapāśena mohastambhabalīyasā // / //
analyzed: na vindati naraḥ yogam putra dāra ādi saṃgataḥ  nibaddhaḥ sneha pāśena moha stambha balīyasā
translated: A man attached to sons, wife, and so on does not attain yoga.🔽Bound by the strong pillar of delusion, by the noose of affection.

analyzed: mohāt kuṭumba saṃsaktaḥ tṛṣṇayā śṛṅkhalīkṛtaḥ
translated: Deluded, attached to the family, chained by craving,

analyzed: bālaiḥ baddhaḥ tu lokaḥ yam musalena abhihanyate
translated: this world is bound by the young and struck by the pestle.

original: ime bālāḥ kathaṃ tyājyā jīviṣyanti mayā vinā /
analyzed: ime bālāḥ katham tyājyāḥ jīviṣyanti mayā vinā
translated: How can these young ones be abandoned? They will not survive without me.

original: mohād dhi cintayaty evaṃ paramārthau na paśyati // / //
analyzed: mohāt hi cintayati evam parama arthau na paśyati  /
translated: Out of delusion, he thinks thus and does not see the ultimate truth.

analyzed: saṃparkāt udare nyastaḥ śukra binduḥ acetanaḥ
translated: The insentient drop of semen deposited in the womb by contact,

original: sa pitrā kena yatnena garbhasthaḥ paripālitaḥ // / //
analyzed: sa pitrā kena yatnena garbha sthaḥ paripālitaḥ
translated: By what effort was he protected by his father while in the womb?

original: karkaśāḥ kaṭhinā bhakṣā jīryante yatra bhakṣitāḥ /
analyzed: karkaśāḥ kaṭhināḥ bhakṣāḥ jīryante yatra bhakṣitāḥ
translated: Where rough and hard food eaten is digested,

original: tasminn evodare śukraṃ kiṃ na jīryati bhakṣyavat // / //
analyzed: tasmin eva udare śukram kim na jīryati bhakṣya vat
translated: why does semen not get digested in the same womb like food?

original: yenaitad yojitaṃ garbhe yena caiva vivardhitam /
analyzed: yena etat yojitam garbhe yena ca eva vivardhitam
translated: By whom this is joined in the womb, by whom it is nourished,

original: tenaiva nirgatṃ bhūyaḥ karmaṇā svena pālyate // / //
analyzed: tena eva nirgatm bhūyas karmaṇā svena pālyate
translated: by that very karma it is protected again when it goes out.

original: na kaścit kasyacit putraḥ pitā mātā na kasyacit /
analyzed: na kaścid kasyacid putraḥ pitā mātā na kasyacid
translated: No one is anyone's son, father or mother.

original: yat svayaṃ prāktanaṃ karma pitā māteti tat smṛtam // / //
analyzed: yat svayam prāktanam karma pitā mātā iti tat smṛtam
translated: One's own past karma is known as father and mother.

original: yena yatra kṛtaṃ karma sa tatraiva prajāyate /
